result.execSummary:
The defendant Dante D. Pignotti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dante D. Pignotti is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dante D. Pignotti was found guilty of Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Dante D. Pignotti was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct.6 in this file and Ct.1 in file 13CF1334.

Minutes:  13CF1334/14CF517.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Celebre.  Victim rights compliance.  Victim present; statement made.  

14CF517 (Ct 6) deft sentenced to 3yrs WSP; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 1 yr of ES.  See conditions.  Credit for 220 days.  Per Court - deft not eligible for ERP or SAP (decided after conclusion of hrg).

13CF1334 - deft sentenced to 6mos WSP consecutive.  Fined $600 plus costs.  Bond to apply.  DL revoked for 24mos.  Ignition interlock ordered for 24mos.  

14CF517 - (1) - sentence w/held; placed on probation for three years consecutive to above sentences.  Probation conditions to be identical to those of ES.  

Appeal rights.

Minutes:  13CF1334 & 14CF517.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty David Celebre.  Cases are resolved.  
13CF1334 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

14CF517 - deft pleads guilty to counts 1 & 6; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Remaining counts are dismissed on State's motion.

PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 11/5/14 @ 1:30pm.

Defendant Dante D. Pignotti appeared with Attorney David E. Celebre.  Defendant in custody @ KCDC.  Attorney Jason Robert Zapf appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue.  Clerk: J. Mattner.
MINUTES:  13CF1334 & 14CF517:  Victim rights compliance and victim present.  Atty Celebre filed motions for discovery and bond mod. and State filed a motion for other acts.  Motion for other acts & discovery to be heard at next hrg.  Arguments heard on the bond motion on 14CF517; State opposes any bond mod.  Court feels bond is to low and raised it to $10,000 cash bond.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 29, 2014 at 10:30 am.

ADA Jason Zapf appeared for the State. Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty. David Celebre. Clerk LE. Plea offer placed on the record by State. Def. rejects offer and proceeds with preliminary hearing. Preliminary hearing held with co-def. in 14CF518. KPD Officer Willie Hamilton sworn in and testified on behalf of the State. Cross-examination by Atty. Celebre and by co-def.'s Atty. Kristyne Watson. Probable cause found. Information not filed. Arraignment on 5-22-14 @ 1:00pm. Judicial pretrial on 7-16-14 @ 8:30am with def.'s other case, 13CF1334. Bond continued.
